CITY AND COUNTY OF SAN FRANCISCO
Mills Meld Municipal Airport of
San Francisco
B1118 .
• Millbrae Dairy Co.
File 531.9
December 22, 1927.
To the Honorable
Board of Public Works of the
City and County of San Francisco.
Gentlemen:
I transmit herewith bills of the Willbrae Dairy Company®
against the City and County of San Francisco In connection with the
cutting of grass and other incidental services at the Mills Fleld
Municipal Airport of San Francisco. These services were rendered
at different times whenever demand was made upon them to level off
the fleld, as conditions warranted such work to be done.
These bills have been checked by this office, and have
my approval.
I recommend that your Board request the Finance Committee
of the Board of Supervisors to set aside in the budget for the year
1928-1929 the sum of $1531 for this purpose.
An appropriation requested by this office for this work
for the fiscal year 1927-1928 was not included in the budget.
Respectfully,
N. M. O'SHAUGHNESSY
City Engineer

properties.sfomuseum:airport: Mills Field Municipal Airport of San Francisco
properties.sfomuseum:creditline: Transfer from City and County of San Francisco
properties.sfomuseum:description: a. Facsimile of memorandum from M. M. O’Shaughnessy, City Engineer, San Francisco Department of Public Works, to Board of Public Works, dated December 22, 1927, concerning removal of grass and hay by Millbrae Dairy Company at Mills Field Municipal Airport and subsequent unauthorized charges to City and County of San Francisco in amount of $1,531.00; copy of File 531.9, not signed;b. spreadsheet calculating cost of labor for grass removal during month of April 1927 ($524.00);c. spreadsheet calculating cost of labor for grass removal during month of May 1927 ($296.00);d. spreadsheet calculating cost of labor for grass removal during month of June 1927 ($128.00);e. spreadsheet calculating cost of labor for grass removal during month of July 1927 ($544.00);f. spreadsheet calculating cost of labor for grass removal during month of August 1927 ($39.00).
